text: Frank Evans Heart (May 15, 1929 â€“ June 24, 2018) was an American computer engineer. He was born in New York City, but was raised in Yonkers, New York. Heart designed the first routing computer for the ARPANET, the predecessor to the Internet. In 2014, Heart was inducted into the Internet Hall of Fame. Heart died of melanoma on June 24, 2018 in Lexington, Massachusetts at the age of 89. ==References== ==Other websites== * Internet Hall of Fame bio * A History of Computer Communications: 1968-1988 Category:1929 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from melanoma Category:Cancer deaths in Massachusetts Category:American computer scientists Category:Engineers from New York (state) Category:Scientists from New York City Category:People from Yonkers, New York
title: Frank Heart
